name: Minotaur Explorer
text: When Minotaur Explorer enters the battlefield, sacrifice it unless you discard a card at random.

editions.flavor: After the invasion devastated the Talruum and Hurloon tribes, the survivors began to search for other minotaurs.

name: Minotaur Illusionist
text:
{1}{U}: Minotaur Illusionist gains shroud until end of turn. (It can't be the target of spells or abilities.)
{R}, Sacrifice Minotaur Illusionist: Minotaur Illusionist deals damage equal to its power to target creature.

name: Minotaur Skullcleaver
text:
Haste
When Minotaur Skullcleaver enters the battlefield, it gets +2/+0 until end of turn.

editions.flavor:
"Their only dreams are of full stomachs."
—Kleon the Iron-Booted

name: Minotaur Tactician
text:
Haste
Minotaur Tactician gets +1/+1 as long as you control a white creature.
Minotaur Tactician gets +1/+1 as long as you control a blue creature.

editions.flavor: The herd's patience, the stampede's fury.

name: Miracle Worker
text: {T}: Destroy target Aura attached to a creature you control.

editions.flavor: "Those blessed hands could bring surcease to even the most tainted soul." —Sister Betje, Miracles of the Saints

name: Miraculous Recovery
text: Return target creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield. Put a +1/+1 counter on it.

editions.flavor: "I am the rock of the polis. Death only strengthens me."

"You stop breathing for just a few minutes and everyone jumps to conclusions."
—Zarkuu, necrosavant

name: Mirari
text: Whenever you cast an instant or sorcery spell, you may pay {3}. If you do, copy that spell. You may choose new targets for the copy.

editions.flavor:
"It offers you what you want, not what you need."
—Braids, dementia summoner

"It offers you what you want, not what you need."
—Braids, dementia summoner

"It offers you what you want, not what you need."
—Braids, dementia summoner

"It offers you what you want, not what you need."
—Braids, dementia summoner

name: Mirari's Wake
text:
Creatures you control get +1/+1.
Whenever you tap a land for mana, add one mana to your mana pool of any type that land produced.

editions.flavor: The land drank power from the Mirari as though it had thirsted forever.
Even after a false god tore magic from Dominaria, power still radiated from the Mirari sword that slew her.
Even after a false god tore the magic from Dominaria, power still radiated from the Mirari sword that slew her.
The land drank power from the Mirari as though it had thirsted forever.

name: Mire Blight
text:
Enchant creature
When enchanted creature is dealt damage, destroy it.

editions.flavor:
"Is there anything in Guul Draz that doesn't suck the life out of you?"
—Tarsa, Sea Gate sell-sword

name: Mire Boa
text:
Swampwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Swamp.)
{G}: Regenerate Mire Boa.

editions.flavor: Mire slime courses through its veins in place of blood. No sooner does it bleed than it opens its mouth to replace the loss.

name: Mire Kavu
text: Mire Kavu gets +1/+1 as long as you control a Swamp.

editions.flavor: "At this rate," said Sisay, "the next kavu we see will have wings."

name: Miren, the Moaning Well
text:
{T}: Add {C} to your mana pool.
{3}, {T}, Sacrifice a creature: You gain life equal to the sacrificed creature's toughness.

name: Mire Shade
text: {B}, Sacrifice a Swamp: Put a +1/+1 counter on Mire Shade. Activate this ability only any time you could cast a sorcery.

editions.flavor:
"We realized the bog had not given up a soul but had come to claim a new one."
—Scout Ekemet, final journal

name: Mire's Malice
text:
Target opponent discards two cards.
Awaken 3—{5}{B} (If you cast this spell for {5}{B}, also put three +1/+1 counters on target land you control and it becomes a 0/0 Elemental creature with haste. It's still a land.)

name: Mire's Toll
text: Target player reveals a number of cards from his or her hand equal to the number of Swamps you control. You choose one of them. That player discards that card.

editions.flavor: As the bridge snapped, Berko was sure he heard the swamp laughing at him.

editions.set: Duel Decks: Nissa vs. Ob Nixilis
editions.flavor: As the bridge snapped, Berko was sure he heard the swamp laughing at him.

name: Mirko Vosk, Mind Drinker
text:
Flying
Whenever Mirko Vosk, Mind Drinker deals combat damage to a player, that player reveals cards from the top of his or her library until he or she reveals four land cards, then puts those cards into his or her graveyard.

name: Mirozel
text:
Flying
When Mirozel becomes the target of a spell or ability, return Mirozel to its owner's hand.

editions.flavor: The mirozels are the only stars in Rath's opaque skies.

name: Mirran Crusader
text: Double strike, protection from black and from green

editions.flavor: A symbol of what Mirrodin once was and hope for what it will be again.
A symbol of what Mirrodin once was and hope for what it will be again.
A symbol of what Mirrodin once was and hope for what it will be again.

name: Mirran Mettle
text:
Target creature gets +2/+2 until end of turn.
Metalcraft — That creature gets +4/+4 until end of turn instead if you control three or more artifacts.

editions.flavor: "Our land will not yield to Phyrexian corruption!"

name: Mirran Spy
text:
Flying
Whenever you cast an artifact spell, you may untap target creature.

editions.flavor: Accurate information is a precious commodity in times of war.

name: Mirri
text: If a basic land you control is tapped for mana, it produces mana of a color of your choice instead of any other type.

editions.flavor: Mirri and Gerrard have been the best of friends since they trained together under the maro-sorcerer Multani. A fierce and agile warrior, she rejoined Gerrard aboard the Weatherlight as his unofficial first mate shortly after he assumed command of the flying ship.

name: Mirri, Cat Warrior
text: First strike, forestwalk, vigilance (This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike, it can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Forest, and attacking doesn't cause this creature to tap.)

editions.flavor:
"Full of beauty and grace, with a predator's instincts . . . Although she wanders, I have always thought Mirri belongs in Llanowar most of all."
—Rofellos, Llanowar emissary

"Full of beauty and grace, with a predator's instincts . . . Although she wanders, I have always thought Mirri belongs in Llanowar most of all."
—Rofellos, Llanowar emissary

name: Mirri's Guile
text: At the beginning of your upkeep, you may look at the top three cards of your library, then put them back in any order.

editions.flavor: Hanna was astounded. Mirri read every leaf and wisp of breeze like a book of ancient lore.

name: Mirri the Cursed
text:
Flying, first strike, haste
Whenever Mirri the Cursed deals combat damage to a creature, put a +1/+1 counter on Mirri the Cursed.

editions.flavor: A hero fails, a martyr falls. Time twists and destinies interchange.

name: Mirri the Cursed Avatar
text: Creatures you control have "{T}: Another target creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn. Put a +1/+1 counter on this creature."

editions.flavor: PLC Prize Avatar

name: Mirrodin's Core
text:
{T}: Add {C} to your mana pool.
{T}: Put a charge counter on Mirrodin's Core.
{T}, Remove a charge counter from Mirrodin's Core: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool.

name: Mirrored Depths
text:
Whenever a player casts a spell, that player flips a coin. If he or she loses the flip, counter that spell.
Whenever you roll {CHAOS}, target player reveals the top card of his or her library. If it's a nonland card, you may cast it without paying its mana cost.

name: Mirror Entity
text:
Changeling (This card is every creature type.)
{X}: Until end of turn, creatures you control have base power and toughness X/X and gain all creature types.

editions.flavor: Unaware of Lorwyn's diversity, it sees only itself, reflected a thousand times over.
Unaware of Lorwyn's diversity, it sees only itself, reflected a thousand times over.
Unaware of Lorwyn's diversity, it sees only itself, reflected a thousand times over.
Unaware of Lorwyn's diversity, it sees only itself, reflected a thousand times over.

name: Mirror Entity Avatar
text: {X}: Choose a creature type. Until end of turn, creatures you control of the chosen type have base power and toughness X/X and gain all creature types.

editions.flavor: LRW Prize Avatar

name: Mirror Gallery
text: The "legend rule" doesn't apply.

editions.flavor: Only in mirrors do heroes find their equal.

name: Mirror Golem
text:
Imprint — When Mirror Golem enters the battlefield, you may exile target card from a graveyard.
Mirror Golem has protection from each of the exiled card's card types. (Artifact, creature, enchantment, instant, land, planeswalker, sorcery, and tribal are card types.)

name: Mirror-Mad Phantasm
text:
Flying
{1}{U}: Mirror-Mad Phantasm's owner shuffles it into his or her library. If that player does, he or she reveals cards from the top of that library until a card named Mirror-Mad Phantasm is revealed. The player puts that card onto the battlefield and all other cards revealed this way into his or her graveyard.

name: Mirror Match
text:
Cast Mirror Match only during the declare blockers step.
For each creature attacking you or a planeswalker you control, create a token that's a copy of that creature and that's blocking that creature. Exile those tokens at end of combat.

name: Mirror Mirror
text:
Mirror Mirror comes into play tapped.
{7}, {T}, Sacrifice Mirror Mirror: At end of turn, exchange life totals with target player and exchange all cards in play that you control, and all cards in your hand, library, and graveyard, with that player until end of game.

name: Mirror Mockery
text:
Enchant creature
Whenever enchanted creature attacks, you may create a token that's a copy of that creature. Exile that token at end of combat.

editions.flavor: Who you are constantly runs toward who you will be.

name: Mirror of Fate
text: {T}, Sacrifice Mirror of Fate: Choose up to seven face-up exiled cards you own. Exile all the cards from your library, then put the chosen cards on top of your library.

editions.flavor: As the glass shattered, forgotten realities and dead memories came flooding back.

name: Mirrorpool
text:
Mirrorpool enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {C} to your mana pool.
{2}{C}, {T}, Sacrifice Mirrorpool: Copy target instant or sorcery spell you control. You may choose new targets for the copy.
{4}{C}, {T}, Sacrifice Mirrorpool: Create a token that's a copy of target creature you control.

name: Mirror Sheen
text: {1}{U/R}{U/R}: Copy target instant or sorcery spell that targets you. You may choose new targets for the copy.

editions.flavor: Even treefolk witches steer clear of the unpredictable woods near Glen Elendra. Spells refract off the glamer-polished trees and the eyes of lurking pucas.

name: Mirror-Sigil Sergeant
text:
Trample
At the beginning of your upkeep, if you control a blue permanent, you may create a token that's a copy of Mirror-Sigil Sergeant.

editions.flavor: "If I had many lives, I would give them all for Bant."

name: Mirror Strike
text: All combat damage that would be dealt to you this turn by target unblocked creature is dealt to its controller instead.

editions.flavor:
"Enemies can be your weapons or your shields. Simply show them which they are."
—The Teachings of Zho

name: Mirror Universe
text: {T}, Sacrifice Mirror Universe: Exchange life totals with target opponent. Activate this ability only during your upkeep.

name: Mirror Wall
text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
{W}: Mirror Wall can attack this turn as though it didn't have defender.

editions.flavor:
"Breaking it would be about four hundred years bad luck."
—Nomad sentry

name: Mirrorweave
text: Each other creature becomes a copy of target nonlegendary creature until end of turn.

editions.flavor:
"Those who are different are untrustworthy, unpredictable. Put your safety in the hands of your own kind."
—Bowen, Barrenton guardcaptain

"Those who are different are untrustworthy, unpredictable. Put your safety in the hands of your own kind."
—Bowen, Barrenton guardcaptain

name: Mirrorwing Dragon
text:
Flying
Whenever a player casts an instant or sorcery spell that targets only Mirrorwing Dragon, that player copies that spell for each other creature he or she controls that the spell could target. Each copy targets a different one of those creatures.

name: Mirrorwood Treefolk
text: {2}{R}{W}: The next time damage would be dealt to Mirrorwood Treefolk this turn, that damage is dealt to target creature or player instead.

editions.flavor: It doesn't need a bite. The bark works just fine.

name: Mirrorworks
text: Whenever another nontoken artifact enters the battlefield under your control, you may pay {2}. If you do, put a token that's a copy of that artifact onto the battlefield.

editions.flavor: The faces of Geth's corpse-dredgers are disturbingly similar.

name: Miscalculation
text:
Counter target spell unless its controller pays {2}.
Cycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)

name: Mischief and Mayhem
text: Up to two target creatures each get +4/+4 until end of turn.

editions.flavor:
"The false god Xenagos treats the whole world as his rollick site. If his whims are left unchecked, Theros will be reduced to rubble and ashes."
—Elspeth

name: Mischievous Poltergeist
text:
Flying
Pay 1 life: Regenerate Mischievous Poltergeist.

editions.flavor:
"The past is a ghost that haunts you from the moment it exists until the moment you don't."
—Gerrard of the Weatherlight

"The past is a ghost that haunts you from the moment it exists until the moment you don't."
—Gerrard of the Weatherlight

name: Mischievous Quanar
text:
{3}{U}{U}: Turn Mischievous Quanar face down.
Morph {1}{U}{U} (You may cast this card face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)
When Mischievous Quanar is turned face up, copy target instant or sorcery spell. You may choose new targets for that copy.

name: Misdirection
text:
You may exile a blue card from your hand rather than pay Misdirection's mana cost.
Change the target of target spell with a single target.

name: Mise
text: Name a nonland card, then reveal the top card of your library. If that card is the named card, draw three cards.

editions.flavor: Statistically mind-staggering as it might seem, the term "mise" was in fact coined simultaneously by over one thousand Magic players.

mise 'miz v alter. of might as well (1997) 1: to win when you don't deserve to 2: to top-deck the "tings" you need 3: to be rewarded by an opponent's bad luck 4: to coin a phrase that spreads through the tournament scene like wildfire 5: to fling a monkey 6: to split firewood using a sharp instrument 7: To burn

name: Misers' Cage
text: At the beginning of each opponent's upkeep, if that player has five or more cards in hand, Misers' Cage deals 2 damage to him or her.

editions.flavor:
"Let him be imprisoned while his possessions wander free."
—Suq'Ata legal decree

name: Misery Charm
text:
Choose one —
• Destroy target Cleric.
• Return target Cleric card from your graveyard to your hand.
• Target player loses 2 life.

name: Misfortune
text:
An opponent chooses one —
• You put a +1/+1 counter on each creature you control and gain 4 life.
• You put a -1/-1 counter on each creature that player controls and Misfortune deals 4 damage to him or her.

name: Misfortune's Gain
text: Destroy target creature. Its owner gains 4 life.

editions.flavor: The mourning families of commanders and generals were often given land, valuables, or money to compensate for their losses.
The mourning families of commanders and generals were often given land, valuables, or money to compensate for their losses.

name: Misguided Rage
text: Target player sacrifices a permanent.

editions.flavor: Only when the anger passed did Varv realize he had burned down his home, destroyed his weapons, and killed his friend Furt.

name: Mishra
text: If a creature you control would deal damage, it deals double that damage instead.

editions.flavor: Both complement and antithesis to his older brother Urza, Mishra also mastered the intricacies of artifice. It was Mishra's strength that first gave rise to the massive Phyrexian war engines on Dominaria, and it was his weakness that pushed him, Urza, and Dominaria itself to the point of annihilation.

name: Mishra, Artificer Prodigy
text: Whenever you cast an artifact spell, you may search your graveyard, hand, and/or library for a card with the same name as that spell and put it onto the battlefield. If you search your library this way, shuffle it.

editions.flavor: A sojourn through time gave dark inspiration to one gifted young mind.

name: Mishra's Bauble
text: {T}, Sacrifice Mishra's Bauble: Look at the top card of target player's library. Draw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.

editions.flavor:
"Arcum is a babbling fool Phyrexian technology is our greatest blessing. Take this delightful trinket for instance . . ."
—Heidar, Rimewind master

name: Mishra's Factory
text:
{T}: Add {C} to your mana pool.
{1}: Mishra's Factory becomes a 2/2 Assembly-Worker artifact creature until end of turn. It's still a land.
{T}: Target Assembly-Worker creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

name: Mishra's Groundbreaker
text: {T}, Sacrifice Mishra's Groundbreaker: Target land becomes a 3/3 artifact creature that's still a land. (This effect lasts indefinitely.)

editions.flavor: The very ground yielded to Mishra's wishes.
The very ground yielded to Mishra's wishes.

name: Mishra's Helix
text: {X}, {T}: Tap X target lands.

editions.flavor: The helix was the finest example of Mishra's campaign strategy: if he couldn't have Argoth, no one could.

name: Mishra's Toy Workshop
text: {T}: Add {C}{C}{C} to your mana pool. Spend this mana only on spells and abilities that put tokens onto the battlefield. Use toys to represent the tokens.

editions.flavor: Even though Urza tried to apologize, Mishra continued to bear a grudge.

name: Mishra's War Machine
text:
Banding (Any creatures with banding, and up to one without, can attack in a band. Bands are blocked as a group. If any creatures with banding you control are blocking or being blocked by a creature, you divide that creature's combat damage, not its controller, among any of the creatures it's being blocked by or is blocking.)
At the beginning of your upkeep, Mishra's War Machine deals 3 damage to you unless you discard a card. If Mishra's War Machine deals damage to you this way, tap it.

name: Mishra's Workshop
text: {T}: Add {C}{C}{C} to your mana pool. Spend this mana only to cast artifact spells.

editions.flavor: Though he eventually came to despise Tocasia, Mishra listened well to her lessons on clarity of purpose. Unlike his brother, he focused his mind on a single goal.
Though he eventually came to despise Tocasia, Mishra listened well to her lessons on clarity of purpose. Unlike his brother, he focused his mind on a single goal.
Though he eventually came to despise Tocasia, Mishra listened well to her lessons on clarity of purpose. Unlike his brother, he focused his mind on a single goal.

name: Misinformation
text: Put up to three target cards from an opponent's graveyard on top of his or her library in any order.

editions.flavor:
"When you cannot rely on your sources, trust your own senses. When you cannot trust those, you must follow your instincts."
—Lovisa Coldeyes, Balduvian chieftain
"When you cannot rely on your sources, trust your own senses. When you cannot trust those, you must follow your instincts." —Lovisa Coldeyes, Balduvian Chieftain

name: Miss Demeanor
text:
Flying, first strike
During each other player's turn, compliment that player on his or her game play or sacrifice Miss Demeanor.

editions.flavor: Even war can be civil.

name: Misshapen Fiend
text: Flying

editions.flavor: You'd scarcely believe they could fly until they drop out of the sky onto you.

Prowess (Whenever you cast a noncreature spell, this creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)
